CatDescriptText: Howard Turner, steward, Bentley Drive and Gertrude Bryant, pharmacy worker, Beltzhoover, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, March 26, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the Federal Government should intervene in the student sit-down demonstrations?"  Mr. Turner's answer reads: "Yes, I do.  Local governments generally do not have the will and if they do they don't have enough power to investigate.  Politics has more to do with local investigations than with Federal intervention."  Ms. Bryant's answer reads: "I think it should because every year there is something new happening against Negroes.  Federal Government intervention would help to right things."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Howard Turner wearing fedora with dark band and moustache, standing on sidewalk with buildings in background, Downtown; Portrait of Gertrude Bryant wearing plaid coat and earmuffs, standing in front of building with glass block window, Downtown
